title: Skoda's Journey Towards Carbon Neutrality - indianautosblog.com
summary: Škoda Auto's subsidiary ŠKO-ENERGO is launching a key project to modernize its plant to use 100% biomass, contributing to Škoda's ambitious environmental targets. The transition to wood chips and phyto-pellets will make energy production fully carbon neutral, resulting in annual CO2 savings of approximately 290,000 tonnes. Škoda Auto is also tightening its environmental targets, aiming for completely carbon-neutral production by the end of the decade and investing in electromobility.
green_innovation: TRUE - This project of modernizing the plant to use 100% biomass aligns with environmental sustainability goals, reduces carbon footprint, and contributes to decarbonization efforts.
business_innovation: TRUE - The modernization project introducing 100% biomass usage at the plant differs significantly from Škoda Auto's previous energy production methods, making it a business innovation.
green_product: FALSE - The article focuses more on a process innovation of shifting to biomass energy production rather than detailing a specific green product.
green_process: TRUE - The transition to using 100% biomass for energy production minimizes environmental impacts, promotes sustainability, and aligns with green process practices.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 336111 - Automobile Manufacturing, 221330 - Steam and Air-Conditioning Supply, 562212 - Solid Waste Landfill, 562998 - All Other Miscellaneous Waste Management Services
greenwashing: FALSE - The article primarily highlights genuine efforts by Škoda Auto and its subsidiary towards environmental sustainability and carbon neutrality, without indications of greenwashing.
